alert.note: Alert for Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 6:25AM AKDT until July 26 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * LOCATION...Kotlik to Hooper Bay. * COASTAL FLOODING...Sea levels will rise 3 to 4 feet above the normal high tides. Southwest winds of 30 to 40 mph will push surge and waves up the beach, and water level will rise on the the Yukon River as far inland as 20 miles inland. * TIMING...Through this 7 PM this evening. The highest water levels are expected this morning. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding over low lying areas is expected. Flooding could occur along the Yukon River as much as 20 miles inland. Objects left on the beach could be washed away. Minor beach erosion will occur.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore.
